title: Late Session
commentary: Bulls running strong into the close: Dow up 0.9% to 49,254, S&P gains 0.8% as risk appetite fully reverses Monday's tariff rout. Bitcoin bounces to $64,428 (+0.3%) unfazed by Putin signing law allowing Russian courts to confiscate crypto—geopolitical noise shrugged off. Silver cools slightly but holds green (+0.8%) at $87.30 while gold treads water (-0.9%) at $5,178. Oil pares losses to -0.4% at $66. Dollar firm at 97.84 as equity rally dominates FX flows.

title: Afternoon Session
commentary: Rally gains momentum into the afternoon: Dow surges 0.9% to 49,223, S&P climbs 0.8% as buyers overwhelm Monday's tariff panic. Silver continues outperforming (+1.6%) to $87.94 while gold pares losses (-0.9%) to $5,178. Bitcoin holds steady at $64,248 as ETF inflows stabilize—break-even traders caught in waiting game. Oil slips 0.8% to $65.76 as demand concerns persist despite Iran tensions. Dollar flat at 97.79 as risk appetite returns.

title: Lunchtime Session
commentary: Dip-buying continues into lunch: Dow holds 0.7% gains at 49,151, S&P climbs 0.6% as traders shake off tariff jitters. Bitcoin rebounds to $64,220 (+0.4%) with UAE's second-largest bank reportedly eyeing BTC exposure—institutional interest persists despite hedge fund exodus. Gold extends correction (-1.4%) to $5,153 as safe-haven trade unwinds, but silver outperforms (+0.8%). Oil fades 0.6% to $65.93 on demand concerns. Dollar eases to 97.77 after testing highs.

title: Midday Rally
commentary: Wall Street extends morning gains as bargain hunters pile in: Dow surges 0.7% to 49,159, S&P up 0.5% clawing back Monday's tariff losses. Silver steals the metals spotlight (+1.5%) to $87.90 while gold continues profit-taking (-1.1%) to $5,170. Bitcoin stabilizes at $63,950 after oldest 2009 whale dumps $1.24B—market digesting the supply shock. Oil slips 0.6% to $65.90 as demand fears override Iran tensions. Dollar holds firm at 97.9 as traders await further tariff clarity.

title: Morning Session
commentary: Equities bounce off Monday's tariff-driven lows: Dow climbs 0.5% to 49,024, S&P edges higher as dip-buyers emerge. Gold extends pullback (-1.4%) to $5,151 after Monday's 3% moonshot, profit-taking inevitable. Crypto stabilizes with Bitcoin finding support at $63,600 after testing sub-$63K overnight—still down 6% from Friday's close. Silver holds green (+0.5%) outperforming gold as industrial demand narrative resurfaces. Dollar firms 0.2% as traders await fresh tariff salvos from the White House.

title: Tuesday Open
commentary: Fresh selling grips markets at the Tuesday bell: Bitcoin plunges below $63K as crypto rout deepens, down 7% from Friday's levels with hedge fund ETF exodus accelerating. Gold pulls back 1.5% to $5,145 after Monday's monster 3% rally, profit-taking inevitable after the safe-haven stampede. Oil catches a bid (+0.8%) on Iran strike jitters while the dollar firms 0.2% to 97.9. Asian markets mixed overnight—Nikkei +0.9%, but Hong Kong sinks 1.8% as tariff contagion spreads.

title: After Hours
commentary: Wall Street licks wounds after brutal session: S&P closed down 1.1%, Nasdaq off 1.2%, Dow surrendered 1.3% as Trump tariff fallout continued to hammer sentiment. Precious metals had a monster day—gold surged 3.3% to $5,248 while silver went parabolic with a 7.6% spike to $88.60, the safe-haven trade in full force. Crypto bleeding persists overnight: Bitcoin hovers at $64,350 (-5%), ETH down 5.2% as hedge funds accelerate their ETF exodus. Oil flat at $66.40, DXY steady at 97.7.

title: Market Close
commentary: Tariff hangover persists into the close: S&P sheds 1.2% while Nasdaq drops 1.4% as Trump's 15% levy fallout continues rattling risk assets. Precious metals steal the show—gold rockets 3.1% to $5,237, silver explodes 6.3% to $87.50 in a stunning haven bid. Crypto carnage unabated as Bitcoin slides 5% to $64,200, hedge fund ETF exodus accelerating. Dollar inches lower at 97.7, oil flat near $66 as trade war fears offset geopolitical premiums.

title: Late Session
commentary: Markets stabilize near session lows: Dow holds -1.5% at 48,890, S&P and Nasdaq both off ~1% as selling exhaustion sets in. Silver explodes 3.6%, gold pushes 2% higher to $5,211 as haven trade intensifies. Crypto finds footing—Bitcoin bounces to $64,700 though still down 5.5% on the day. Oil slides deeper into red (-0.5%) on demand destruction fears. Nat gas tumbles 2% as storm premium fades.

title: Afternoon Selloff
commentary: Selling pressure persists into afternoon: Dow off 1.5% near session lows, Russell 2000 small-caps crater -2.3% as tariff fallout ripples through risk assets. Crypto bloodbath deepens—Bitcoin sinks to $64,500 (-5.8%), Ethereum down 5.5% as institutional exodus accelerates. Oil slides into negative territory (-0.4%) on global growth fears. Gold holds firm at $5,208 (+1.9%), silver rips 2.8% as haven flows dominate.
